title: Jose Mourinho says will leave Chelsea only if he loses players’ trust
text:
Manchester United's Martial brushes aside Thierry Henry's comparison Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho has revealed that the only thing which can make him step down from his post is losing his players’ trust.
Mourinho said he will resign if the players say they don’t trust him.
According to the Mirror, former footballer Jamie Redknapp claimed that the team is no longer listening to Mourinho.
Reacting to the claims, the 52-year-old said that one should not go with the views of fake sources and should directly ask the players regarding their opinions.
Earlier, Chelsea skipper John Terry had described Jose Mourinho as the best manager for his club, saying he is the only one who can get them out of their current dreadful start to their Premier League season.
Chelsea have claimed only two wins from the eight games that they have played, including their recent 1-3 defeat to Southampton.
They are currently at 16th spot with eight points in the EPL table and will next lock horns with Aston Villa on October 17.
 05, 2015 4:49 pm
